etymology.description: 言(言) (yán, "word") + 𠯑(𠯑) as phonetic = related to speech -> speech; words; utterance; language
etymology.interpretation: 話(話) (huà, "speech") combines 言(言) (yán, "word") for its semantic meaning and 𠯑 for phonetic purposes, indicating its relation to verbal communication.
etymology.simplification: 話(話) was simplified to 话(話) by replacing 言(言) with 讠(讠) (yán, "speech") for a cursive shorthand representation.

examples.chinese: 他说的每一句话(他說的每一句話)，都充满智慧(都充滿智慧)。
examples.pinyin: Tā shuō de měi yī jù huà, dōu chōngmǎn zhìhuì.
examples.english: Every word he speaks is full of wisdom.

examples.chinese: 一句好话(一句好話)，胜过千言万语(勝過千言萬語)。
examples.pinyin: Yī jù hǎo huà, shèng guò qiān yán wàn yǔ.
examples.english: A kind word surpasses a thousand words.
